definitions.definition: To switch on
definitions.example: Can you on the light?

definitions.definition: In the state of being active, functioning or operating.
definitions.example: All the lights are on, so they must be home.

definitions.definition: Performing according to schedule; taking place.
definitions.example: Are we still on for tonight?

definitions.definition: Fitted; covering; being worn.
definitions.example: I was trying to drink out of the bottle while the top was still on!

definitions.definition: (usually negative) Acceptable, appropriate.
definitions.example: You can't do that; it's just not on.

definitions.definition: Destined, normally in the context of a challenge being accepted; involved, doomed.
definitions.example: "Five bucks says the Cavs win tonight." ―"You're on!"

definitions.definition: Having reached a base as a runner and being positioned there, awaiting further action from a subsequent batter.
Within the half of the field on the same side as the batsman's legs; the left side for a right-handed batsman.
definitions.example: Ponsonby-Smythe hit a thumping on drive.

definitions.definition: Menstruating.
To an operating state.
definitions.example: turn the television on

definitions.definition: So as to cover or be fitted.
definitions.example: Put on your hat and gloves.

definitions.definition: Along, forwards (continuing an action).
definitions.example: drive on, rock on

definitions.definition: In continuation, at length.
definitions.example: He rambled on and on.

definitions.definition: (obsolete in the US) Later.
definitions.example: Ten years on, nothing had changed in the village.

definitions.definition: Of betting odds, denoting a better-than-even chance. See also odds-on.
definitions.example: That horse is twenty-to-one on, so you need to stake twenty pounds just to win one pound.

definitions.definition: Positioned at the upper surface of, touching from above.
definitions.example: A vase of flowers stood on the table.

definitions.definition: Positioned at or resting against the outer surface of; attached to.
definitions.example: He had a scar on the side of his face.

definitions.definition: Expressing figurative placement or attachment.
definitions.example: All of the responsibility is on him.

definitions.definition: Denoting performance or action by contact with the surface, upper part, or outside of anything; hence, by means of; with.
definitions.example: to play on a violin or piano

definitions.definition: At or in (a certain region or location).
definitions.example: The lighthouse that you can see is on the mainland.

definitions.definition: Near; adjacent to; alongside.
definitions.example: Croton-on-Hudson, Rostov-on-Don, Southend-on-Sea

definitions.definition: Supported by (the specified part of itself).
definitions.example: A table can't stand on two legs.

definitions.definition: So as to impart force to.
definitions.example: tug on the rope; push hard on the door

definitions.definition: So as to impact; against.
definitions.example: I stubbed my toe on an old tree stump.

definitions.definition: Covering.
definitions.example: He wore old shoes on his feet.

definitions.definition: (with certain modes of transport, especially public transport) Inside (a vehicle) for the purpose of travelling.
definitions.example: on a bus, on a train, on a plane

definitions.definition: At the date of.
definitions.example: Born on the 4th of July.

definitions.definition: Some time during the day of.
definitions.example: Can I see you on a different day?

definitions.definition: At a given time after the start of something; at.
definitions.example: Smith scored again on twelve minutes, doubling Mudchester Rovers' lead.

definitions.definition: Dealing with the subject of; about; concerning.
definitions.example: I have no opinion on this subject.

definitions.definition: In the possession of.
definitions.example: I haven't got any money on me.

definitions.definition: Because of, or due to.
definitions.example: to arrest someone on suspicion of bribery

definitions.definition: Upon; at the time of (and often because of).
definitions.example: On Jack's entry, William got up to leave.

definitions.definition: Paid for by.
definitions.example: I paid for the airfare and meals for my family, but the hotel room was on the company.

definitions.definition: Indicating a means or medium.
definitions.example: Can't you see I'm on the phone?

definitions.definition: Indicating the target of, or thing affected by, an event or action.
definitions.example: Her words made a lasting impression on my mind.

definitions.definition: Toward; for; indicating the object of an emotion.
definitions.example: Have pity or compassion on him.

definitions.definition: Indicating a means of subsistence.
definitions.example: The dog survived three weeks on rainwater.

definitions.definition: Away or occupied with (e.g. a scheduled activity).
definitions.example: He's on his lunch break.

definitions.definition: Regularly taking (a drug).
definitions.example: He's acting so strangely, I think he must be on something.

definitions.definition: Under the influence of (a drug).
definitions.example: He's acting crazy because he's on crack right now.

definitions.definition: Having identical domain and codomain.
definitions.example: a function on

definitions.definition: Having V^n as domain and V as codomain, for some set V and integer n.
definitions.example: an operator on

definitions.definition: Generated by.
definitions.example: the free group on four letters

definitions.definition: In addition to; besides; indicating multiplication or succession in a series.
definitions.example: heaps on heaps of food

definitions.definition: Of
Indicating dependence or reliance; with confidence in.
definitions.example: He will promise on certain conditions.

definitions.definition: At the peril of, or for the safety of.
In the service of; connected with; of the number of.
definitions.example: He is on a newspaper; I am on the committee.

definitions.definition: By virtue of; with the pledge of.
definitions.example: He affirmed or promised on his word, or on his honour.

definitions.definition: To the account or detriment of; denoting imprecation or invocation, or coming to, falling, or resting upon.
definitions.example: A curse on him!

definitions.definition: (especially when numbers of combatants or competitors are specified) Against; in opposition to.
definitions.example: The fight was three on one, and he never stood a chance.

definitions.definition: Without.
In the Japanese language, a pronunciation, or reading, of a kanji character that was originally based on the character's pronunciation in Chinese, contrasted with kun.
definitions.example: Most kanji have two kinds of reading, called "on" and "kun".
